epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern exceeding 0.1% by weight
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete through carbonation is not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Some environmental impact indicators have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground

contact_information.disclaimer: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change. Users must determine suitability. Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage from use or reliance on this information.
